parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post is clearly related to the Romanian parliamentary elections and targets the Hungarian minority, it does not explicitly mention any specific candidate by name or implicitly endorse a particular candidate. The call to vote is general, urging the Hungarian community to vote to protect their interests.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience within the Hungarian community in Romania. The targeting parameters further confirm this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage the Hungarian minority in Romania to vote in the parliamentary elections. The message highlights the perceived threat to their interests and frames voting as a means of self-preservation.  While not explicitly endorsing a specific candidate, the overall message strongly implies that voting is crucial for the Hungarian community's political representation and future.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It presents a biased perspective, emphasizing the perceived threat to the Hungarian community and urging them to vote to counter this threat. This is not an attempt to provide balanced information but rather to mobilize a specific voting bloc.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it presents a political message aimed at influencing voter behavior within a specific community.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1120849286226912</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while not explicitly mentioning any candidate, constitutes electoral propaganda. It targets a specific demographic (the Hungarian minority in Romania) during the election period, urging them to vote to protect their interests.  The message is clearly designed to influence voter turnout and behavior, fulfilling the criteria of Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. The paid nature of the post on a public platform further strengthens this conclusion.  While it doesn't directly advocate for or against a specific candidate, the implicit call to action is undeniably geared towards influencing the electoral outcome for the Hungarian community. The targeting of specific regions with significant Hungarian populations (Covasna, Harghita, Mureș) further reinforces the intention to influence the election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>RMDSZ</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1120849286226912), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care îndeamnă la vot comunitatea maghiară din România, accentuând amenințări percepute la adresa intereselor lor.  Postarea, deși nu menționează candidați specifici, are un efect electoral clar, vizând mobilizarea unui bloc electoral specific.  Țintarea geografică a județelor Covasna, Harghita și Mureș, cu populație maghiară semnificativă, confirmă intenția de a influența alegerile.  Textul postării, cu fraze precum "Veszélyben vagyunk!", "Rajtad múlik" și "nem veszíthetnek",  constituie o formă de propagandă electorală, îndeplinind criteriile articolului 36 (7) din LEGEA nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  Cheltuielile pentru această postare, conform Ad Library, sunt sub 100 RON, dar impactul potențial asupra alegerilor este semnificativ, având în vedere numărul de impresii (6K-7K) și estimarea de reach (100K-500K).  Contactul RMDSZ este disponibil la kommunikacio@rmdsz.ro și +40742125468.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
